description:
Using any of the euca-xxx tools, an error message is generated, the last line is the following:

---->8----

OperationalError: (OperationalError) no such table: users u'SELECT users.created_at AS users_created_at, users.updated_at AS users_updated_at, users.deleted_at AS users_deleted_a
t, users.deleted AS users_deleted, users.id AS users_id, users.name AS users_name, users.access_key AS users_access_key, users.secret_key AS users_secret_key, users.is_admin AS u
sers_is_admin \nFROM users \nWHERE users.access_key = ? AND users.deleted = ? \n LIMIT 1 OFFSET 0' (u'<SNIPPED>', False)

----8<-----

here nova.conf sql_connection:

---->8----

--sql_connection=mysql://root:<pw_snipped>@127.0.0.1/nova

----8<----

The database exists, the tables are created and the users-table contains data. I´ve completly resetted the whole databaste, the error still exists.

Any ideas?

Thanks in advance.
title: unable to access users table

comments.content:
Using any of the euca-xxx tools, an error message is generated, the last line is the following:

---->8----

OperationalError: (OperationalError) no such table: users u'SELECT users.created_at AS users_created_at, users.updated_at AS users_updated_at, users.deleted_at AS users_deleted_a
t, users.deleted AS users_deleted, users.id AS users_id, users.name AS users_name, users.access_key AS users_access_key, users.secret_key AS users_secret_key, users.is_admin AS u
sers_is_admin \nFROM users \nWHERE users.access_key = ? AND users.deleted = ? \n LIMIT 1 OFFSET 0' (u'<SNIPPED>', False)

----8<-----

here nova.conf sql_connection:

---->8----

--sql_connection=mysql://root:<pw_snipped>@127.0.0.1/nova

----8<----

The database exists, the tables are created and the users-table contains data. I´ve completly resetted the whole databaste, the error still exists.

Any ideas?

Thanks in advance.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~naehring

comments.content:
This looks as if nova-manage is trying to connect to a different database than the one in your nova.conf.  Likely, it is creating a SQLite database and seeing that there is no tables created?

Is it picking up an alternate nova.conf somewhere?

-jay
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content:
Okay, it was a wrong version of a python-<putsomethinghere>. I´ve updated all to the corresponding versions and now it works fine. Please close. 

Thanks, Jay.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~naehring

comments.content: Cheers, and thanks for the update, Andre! Closing.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes
